issues.description: The constructor parameter ordering/signatures for RollerCoaster and LaunchedRollerCoaster are inconsistent in the solution code. RollerCoaster declares a constructor with signature (String name, int numberOfLoopings, char abbreviation) but LaunchedRollerCoaster's constructor has signature (String name, char abbreviation, int numberOfLoopings) and calls super(name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings). The mismatched parameter order (char vs int) means the subclass's super(...) call does not match the superclass constructor signature and will cause a compile-time error and confusion about the intended constructor parameter order.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the constructor parameter order consistent between RollerCoaster and its subclass. For example, change RollerCoaster's constructor to public RollerCoaster(String name, char abbreviation, int numberOfLoopings) { super(name, abbreviation); this.numberOfLoopings = numberOfLoopings; } so it matches LaunchedRollerCoaster's super(name, abbreviation, numberOfLoopings) call. Alternatively, adjust LaunchedRollerCoaster to accept (String name, int numberOfLoopings, char abbreviation) and call super(name, numberOfLoopings, abbreviation) to match the current RollerCoaster signature. Ensure all constructors follow the same parameter ordering convention (and the UML-derived ordering used in the exercise) to avoid compile errors and student confusion.
